system.description: Fierce and brazen, these mages are always at war. The arms dealers of the world, their magic is completely focused on destruction and thus they seek to create bigger and better ways to blow things up. Passionate, wild and a bit chaotic, these mages like the mountains and underground spaces. If you are playing a Flame Mage be hot tempered, war-like, ready for battle, and consuming everything.

overview.base: Having mastered the basic techniques in this field of magic, you are able to cast more advanced spells. If you create any Elder Sorcery spells of your own, they get added to this list. However, just because you "know" how to cast these spells, doesn't mean you are always prepared to. Although all mage classes grant their own elder sorcery and rotator spells, you may only have a maximum of 2 Ã— (MR - 1) of these spells rotated into your spell list at any given time across all classes. MR refers to the number of ranks you have in mage classes. During a long rest, you can "rotate" which spells you have prepared. The rotator spells automatically available to you are Bellows, Control and Resist Fire, Crown of Flame, Melting Grasp, and Rupture Mark.
overview.proficient: You may instead prepare P of these spells.
overview.fluent: You may instead prepare F of these spells.

overview.base: The next spell you cast that would deal damage is boosted.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, the next spell you cast is boosted again.

overview.base: Your standard damage increases by [[/roll 1d4[magic fire]]] damage. You also resist fire damage.
A small circle of smokeless fire circles above your head. You gain Burning Touch and Inferno Aura.

results.hit: Deal [[/roll 1d6[fire magic]]] damage to target.
results.critHit: Double the damage dice dealt by this ability.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, deal an additional [[/roll 1d6[magic fire]]] damage.

results.fail: Deal [[/roll 1d6[magic fire]]] damage to target.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, deal an additional [[/roll 1d6[magic fire]]] damage..

results.hit: Target's next conjured spell does not trigger reactions.

overview.base: You gain Elder Sorcery Creation, Celestial Elder Sorcery Words, and Flame Elder Sorcery Words.

You may create 1 custom "rotator" spells using Elder Sorcery words that you know using whatever Elder Sorcery creation rules are dictated to you by your GM. As with other rotators, this spell is not always available to you. You have to "rotate" into having it prepared. This spell may have a maximum number of words equal to your level. Your GM may allow you to "improvise" spells as well, using whatever rules they wish.
overview.proficient: You may now create 2 Ã— (MR - 1) custom "rotator" spells where MR is the number of ranks you have in mage classes.
overview.fluent: In addition to the spells that you crate, you can learn P additional spells from other Elder Sorcery users. See Elder Sorcery for more information.

value.variable: Creation cost is at least 1 MP per OP of each word in the spell plus 3 Ã— MP of the spell itself.
Creation cost is at least 3 Ã— HP of the spell itself.

costs.materialCost: Creation cost is at least 3 Ã— the material components of the spell itself.
